summary_reasoning: Explicitness: Several core inputs are stated, particularly in “Fair Value and Profit Drivers” and the Appendix (e.g., revenue growth bands, gross margin target, WACC, terminal growth, forward P/E). Specificity: Many assumptions include magnitudes and time horizons (e.g., “25–30% through FY27,” “72–75%,” “WACC 12.5%,” “terminal growth 3%”), though share count is qualitative only. Justification: Support is weak—figures are largely asserted without reconciliation to multi-year history, peer benchmarks, or citations. WACC and terminal growth lack any source or derivation; margin and growth assumptions have minimal linkage to the model tables or segment history. Consistency: A numeric contradiction appears—narrative states “annual growth … approximately 25–30% through FY27,” yet the table shows FY26E→FY27E total revenue growth of 20%, below the stated band. Segment assumptions (Data Center 25–30% CAGR) are not reconciled to consolidated growth that decelerates to mid-teens, creating coherence concerns. Sensitivity/Stress-testing: No quantified sensitivity or scenario analysis is provided for material drivers (growth, margins, WACC, terminal growth, share count), nor is valuation impact of ranges quantified. Under the hard caps, the absence of sensitivities plus an internal numerical contradiction leads to a Poor grade, despite some enumerated inputs.

assumptions_extracted.quote: annual growth moderating from current 70%+ levels to approximately 25-30% through FY27
EPS growth of approximately 30% annually through FY27
share count stability following recent buyback authorizations, with modest dilution from employee stock compensation programs

contradictions.description: Narrative says consolidated revenue growth ~25–30% annually through FY27, but table shows FY26E→FY27E growth of 20%.

unjustified_parameters: Data Center CAGR 25–30% not reconciled to consolidated growth path
